page.title: 05THE SCHOOL DAY-A PUPILS VIEW
page.content: {A School Day - a pupil's view} I would be dragged out of bed by my mother and be washed and dressed by 8.00. I would have a breakfast of cereal and milk. I pack my bag and I am ready to leave by 8.30. I walk about half a mile to get to school. School begins at 9.00 and after registration we have a half hour assembly in the hall. The morning is filled with lessons in English, maths, science and reading. There is a break at 10.30 during which I eat crisps and play with my best friend. Dinner is at twelve midday. There is another short break at 2.30 p.m. During the afternoon we do more lessons and work and sometimes have games or if it is in the summer, we go swimming. School finishes at 3.35 p.m. I walk home and either read a book, do some homework or watch television.
